turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Geology of the Canyonlands area.
turn.1: What are the different colored slopes along with the Chinle Formation?
turn.2: The brightly colored shales of the slope-forming Chinle Formation were laid down on top of this eroded surface.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Petrified wood from the Petrified Forest Member of the Chinle is sometimes found at the base of Chinle slopes.
turn.5: What is the Glen Canyon Group?
turn.6: The Glen Canyon Group of formations includes (from oldest - lowest - to youngest) the These formations are most prominently exposed in the western and northern sections of the park.
turn.7: Did the Triassic period have any major changes?
turn.8: Triassic climates progressively became dryer, prompting the formation of sand dunes that buried dry stream beds and their flood plain.
turn.9: Did the sand eventually become rock?
turn.10: This sand became the cliff-forming several hundred feet (many tens of meters) high and red-colored Windgate Sandstone.
turn.12: Outcrops tend to run for hundreds of miles (hundreds of kilometers) with few breaks, creating an impediment to human travel.
